title: MacCap claims BizInsure mandate, seeks new investor
text:
It is understood the company makes about $25 million a year in earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation, and is after a "strategic partner" to help open new doors and drive future growth.

Sources said that a strategic partner could take up to a 40 per cent stake in the business via the Macquarie Capital-run process, although we've seen enough of these strategic partner searches to know that if a buyer turned up with a knock-out bid for the whole lot then the business may well change hands.

BizInsure is majority-owned by its founder, while there are a bunch of staff and other individuals that have small stakes.

Sources said Macquarie Capital had been appointed to find a strategic partner to fund growth and was about to start sending out formal sale documents to potential investors.

It is understood interested parties have been told BizInsure has recorded year-on-year revenue growth in excess of 30 per cent, and positive numbers at both the cashflow and profit lines.

They were told BizInsure is a leading marketplace player in Australia, was growing its New Zealand business and had a small presence in the United States.

Prospective private equity and financial buyers are expected to compare it to venture capital-backed CoverWallet and Insureon in the United States and Simply Business in the United Kingdom.

However, BizInsure will be at pains to point out that there are no direct comparable companies because it does more than just generate leads for underwriters. BizInsure's pitch is that its platform sees the small business client through from investigation to transaction.
description: Meet the future of small business insurance – it's online, profitable and growing quickly.
